data.text: @GawainHewitt @matthewscharles it could potentially damage the iPad, the Touch Board or both.
Hey @GawainHewitt you could do that, but the results would be your responsibility as there a lot of ways that could go wrong.
@BareConductive @matthewscharles could we hack a usb cable, - data going to the iPad, and power from lipo, regulator bringing it up to 5v?
@matthewscharles  but if there is a USB connection it will use that power instead (and charge the battery from the USB power).
@matthewscharles You can connect a Lithium Polymer (LiPo) cell to the white JST connector on the Touch Board and use that power.
@matthewscharles A powered USB hub should be able to make up the difference, plugged in between the iPad and the Touch Board.
Hey @matthewscharles, it depends on what else you connect to the Touch Board extra power may be required.
